Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, one edge burnt, remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a list of wine jars.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.119)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87625) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87625)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 135 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
